page.title: 13Furniture restorer (2)
page.content: When making new furniture wood from the timber merchant is not used. Instead,they cannibalise old,disused pieces of furniture(tables,sideboards, wardrobes and cupboards )because the wood from these is well seasoned.They obtain most of this from auctions but also from people who ask them to clear unwanted furniture from their homes. Mr Perrin uses machinary to cut the wood to size and to plane but the rest of the work is done with hand tools. Scotch glue made from animal bones,is used in preference to synthetic glues.The polisher uses'button' polish(made from beetles) shellac,garnet polish and 'Briwax" for pine.The business advertises in a local free advertiser booklet,but their customers are drawn from the whole of the West Country.
